meta.description: Canonical assets and treatments for the actual projected holographs at North and South poles (Aurora 3D). Full picture quality. Not landing page only — this spec drives what is projected at the ionospheric F-layer.
meta.source: lib/aurora_vfx.ts, Project Bison & Campfire (Agüeybaná el Gran Sol 1493 Legacy)

north_pole.label: AURORA 3D North
north_pole.surface: Northern hemisphere auroral oval (65–70° N), F-layer

bison_holograph.role: Full-picture-quality reference for the Bison silhouette projected at the pole. Dark-furred bison in profile; shaggy head, hump, distinct silhouette. Rendered as global crimson halo (Earth's Crown), 630 nm Oxygen-Red; space-grade luminosity for Satellite/ISS/Lunar top-down visibility.

north_pole.wireframe_placement: Vertices from lib/aurora_vfx.ts (BISON_WIREFRAME, BISON_GATHERING_WIREFRAME, BISON_RUNNING_WIREFRAME) mapped to lat/long via mapToAuroralLat/Long; visual at those coordinates filled from this asset.

south_pole.label: AURORA 3D South
south_pole.surface: Southern hemisphere auroral oval (65–70° S), F-layer

bison_holograph.role: Same full-picture-quality Bison reference; mirrored for Southern hemisphere. Crimson halo, Earth's Crown.

campfire_ring.label: Campfire — Violet Ring of Fire
campfire_ring.role: Full-picture-quality reference for the Campfire projected at the base of the atmosphere. Teepee-style flames, dynamic upward reach, glowing core. Rendered as violet Ring of Fire (400 nm); same form and luminosity distribution as reference, spectrum shifted to violet.
